title: Font of a Spanish brand called "Cacaolat"
content:
This brand is popular in Spain, especially on the notheast. It's a brand about cacao milkshakes.

Here i have some images of the main logo:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317190544im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_6325.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317190544im_/http:/typophile.com/files/proj_logo_648_3440.jpg)

And there is one with the brand emblem, a boy with a bottle and a bag:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317190544im_/http:/typophile.com/files/project_cover_3672.jpg)

Thank you all, guys!

EDIT:  
You are right, guys. It's a similar variant of the "Coca-Cola" font.  
On the "kthomps5" links you can find Coca-Cola font is a combination of "American Pop One" and "American Pop Two".  
In my case, Cacaolat is only American Pop One, corresponding at the "Coca" from "Coca-Cola", so the font has been found.  
Thank you all, and thank you kthomps5 for the links!

Font: 

 American Pop One 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317190544/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")
author: vcb94

comments.content:
Most likely custom calligraphy/type design, based on the historical labels:  
 [http://cacaolat.es/en/historia/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317190544/http:/cacaolat.es/en/historia/ "http://cacaolat.es/en/historia/")

The style is often referred to these days as baseball script, and some of the modern typefaces in that style include "tail" versions of letters:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/baseball+script/fonts/#item\_65](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317190544/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/baseball+script/fonts/#item_65 "http://www.myfonts.com/search/baseball+script/fonts/#item\_65")

Here are a few typefaces from the list that seem most similar to me:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/american-pop/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317190544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/american-pop/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/american-pop/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/machiarge/machiarge/glyphs.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317190544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/machiarge/machiarge/glyphs.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/machiarge/machiarge/glyphs.html")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/brewmaster/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317190544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/brewmaster/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/brewmaster/")
If you need it just for personal use, one of the various “fan fonts” inspired by the Coca-Cola logo could do.
I think there's one fan font called Loki Cola...
